title: Mathematical Data Analysis Design Utilizing Spatial Thinking and GIS

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental mathematics concepts (coordinate systems, graph interpretation) and digital device usage ability
context.additional_context: Utilizing cloud-based GIS simulation tools in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment. Strengthening project-based activities that convert real spatial data into mathematical problems.

learning_goals: Learners can convert 3D spatial data into 2D coordinate systems and analyze mathematical patterns using GIS simulation tools.
Learners can visualize spatiotemporal change data (e.g., population migration, terrain changes) as graphs and perform trend analysis.
Learners can apply strategies to reduce cognitive load during mathematical modeling processes through GIS-based simulations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
